events.brief_description: Toast the Norton Center with fresh country, smooth bourbon and modern art!Help us kick-off our 50th Anniversary Season at a summertime block party on the plaza.
events.description:
The RSVP window for the Norton Center's 50th Anniversary Block Party has ended. We've had a fantastic response and thanks to friends and patrons like you, we've reached our event capacity!

Toast the Norton Center with fresh country, smooth bourbon and modern art!Help us kick-off our 50th Anniversary Season at a summertime block party on the plaza.

Sip craft cocktails by Maker's Mark while enjoying live music by emerging country music artist and American Idol alum Alex Miller. Preview the new exhibition featuring prints by Andy Warhol, Adolph Gottlieb and other Modern Art pioneers. Then stop by the stage for an unforgettable photo booth experience and enter to win box seats at Churchill Downs, a goat yoga experience and a micro electric guitar at the giveaway station.

While you're here, purchase tickets to a show or buy a season subscription package and save up to 25% on regular priced tickets.
events.title: Norton Center 50th Anniversary Block Party

events.brief_description: Katherine Blanford has brought her human Golden Retriever presence to stages across the country where she has shared the stage with the likes of Jeff Foxworthy, David Spade and Ron White.
events.description:
Katherine Blanford has brought her human Golden Retriever presence to stages across the country where she has shared the stage with the likes of Jeff Foxworthy, David Spade and Ron White.

She shares true confessions of a washed up Pediatric Waste Management Specialist (a nanny) and war stories from the front lines of brunch. Her humor has taken her to festivals across the nation including Limestone Comedy Festival, Laughing Skull Comedy Festival, 10,000 Laughs, Burning Bridges Festival and Red Clay Festival. Her debut album, Salt Daddy, released in June 2022 and hit #1 on ITunes Comedy Charts.

You can catch her weekly co-hosting her podcast, Cheaties, with fellow ATL comedian, Lace Larrabee. The juicy series follows two comedians interviewing guests about their personal stories of cheating and being cheated on and helping each other heal through laughter. Cheaties has been consecutively ranked in Podcast Magazine's Hot 50 and continues to climb the charts.

TICKETS ARE NON-REFUNDABLE - ALL SALES ARE FINAL

Doors open 30 minutes prior to the show

All shows are 18 and up with ID

One Drink Minimum, Must be 21 with valid ID to purchase alcohol.
events.title: Katherine Blanford

events.brief_description: Matilda the Musical at Leeds Center for the Arts in Winchester, KY!
events.description:
Join us at the Leeds Center for the Arts for Matilda the Musical!


The story of an extraordinary girl who dares to take a stand and change her own destiny! Roald Dahl’s heroine might be small, but she stands up to bullies and fights for what’s right, while having plenty of fun along the way. 

Clever Matilda Wormwood is unappreciated by her shallow family, but when she attends an unusual school, she finds a new ally, teacher Miss Honey, and a fearsome foe, headmistress Miss Trunchbull. Handily, our heroine has some special skills. One is magical, the gift of telekinesis, but she also realizes the power of storytelling – and so does this incredible production. 


Show weekends will be August 11th-13th, 18th-20th, and 25th-17th. Tickets can be purchased at the door or online at Leedscenter.org
events.title: Matilda

events.brief_description: Step into the world of the March sisters at the first show of Spotlight's 20th season.
events.description:
Step into the world of the March sisters at The Spotlight Playhouse in Berea, KY, as The Bluegrass Players proudly present Little Women, the first show of Spotlight's 20th season. Adapted for the stage by Scott Davidson from Louisa May Alcott's enduring classic, this tale of love, family, and personal discovery, directed by Chad Hembree, will captivate audiences of all generations. Explore the intricate journeys of Meg, Jo, Amy, and Beth from childhood to maturity during the tumultuous times of the American Civil War. Experience Meg's fierce independence, Amy's grand European adventure, and the poignant loss of beloved Beth, all leading to Jo's momentous achievement—the publication of her first novel. This beautifully compressed adaptation delivers all the warmth, family loyalty, and traditional values intrinsic to Alcott's masterpiece, written 140 years ago yet still profoundly relevant today. Come, relive this timeless classic and find a new understanding of your own life through the March family's joys, pains, and growth.

Performed by the Bluegrass Players
events.title: Little Women

events.brief_description: A fun day in beautiful Downtown Mt. Sterling!
events.description:
A fun day in beautiful Downtown Mt. Sterling!

Start off with the 5K on Saturday morning at Silver Creek Estates and a trip to the Farmers Market on S. Maysville. Then, take a trip down memory lane at the Lions Club Car Show behind the Downtown Athletic Club, participate in the Gateway Children's Services Corn hole Tournament behind Whitaker Bank and shop from over 50 pop up arts and crafts vendors around the bricked streets in the Courthouse Square. Take time to discover what's new at the many downtown shops and restaurants.

The Sterling Health Fair and Kids Zone will be set up beside the Courthouse and the Arts Center and History Museum will also be open to tour.

The Small Town America Talent Show on the Courthouse Lawn is fun entertainment and the winner of this singing contest will receive a $500 cash prize and appearances at various events! Show starts at 1pm.

The Paint the Small Town Event brings "In Plein Aire" Artists for live painting throughout Mt. Sterling. The event ends with a reception at 5pm at the Gateway Regional Arts Center for judging and an opportunity to purchase a one of a kind painting.

Thank you to presenting sponsor- Whitaker Bank!
events.title: 2023 Small Town America Festival

events.brief_description: Formed in late 2012 by vocalist Matt James and drummer Nathan Gillis in the small East Texas town of Palestine, Blacktop Mojo’s fiery blend of sludgy grooves, classic rock guitar riffs, and southern metal shredding falls somewhere between Soundgarden and Lynyrd Skynyrd to form a sound deemed by some as "Texas Grunge."
events.description:
Formed in late 2012 by vocalist Matt James and drummer Nathan Gillis in the small East Texas town of Palestine, Blacktop Mojo’s fiery blend of sludgy grooves, classic rock guitar riffs, and southern metal shredding falls somewhere between Soundgarden and Lynyrd Skynyrd to form a sound deemed by some as "Texas Grunge." The music draws on a multitude of genres and styles to form a hodgepodge of dirty, heavy rock and roll mixed with sensual and at times even, carnal blues.

After their debut album I Am in 2014, The band spent a few years cutting their teeth in dive bars, dancehalls, and honky tonks around Texas. In 2017, during the recording of their sophomore record Burn The Ships the guys quit their day jobs, moving into a small house together in Palestine. The house created an unbreakable fellowship between the band and a culture of constant creativity.

Released via their label Cuhmon Records, Burn The Ships yielded two top 40 singles on the Mainstream Active Rock charts including "Where The Wind Blows" (#27) and a cover of the Aerosmith classic, "Dream On" (#31). After the album cycle and touring for Burn The Ships concluded, the guys returned home in 2018, where they locked themselves in the band house for six months to write their third record, Under The Sun. The record yielded them another top 40 single in "Can't Sleep" (#27) and the band continued touring in the US through the beginning of 2020.

Locked down with the rest of the world and unable to continue touring, the guys began work on their fourth, self-titled album, which is slated to be released in Summer of 2021.
events.title: Blacktop Mojo

events.brief_description: The return of spring means the return of one of Lexington's longest-running and most beloved concert series.
events.description:
The return of spring means the return of one of Lexington's longest-running and most beloved concert series – Big Band & Jazz. With a full schedule of live music planned, concert-goers can enjoy weekly big band or jazz music at Moondance Amphitheater (May - June) and Ecton Park (July - August). Picnics are encouraged and patrons should bring a lawn chair or blanket for seating.

Schedule:

  • July 25 – Miles Osland Little Big Band with Vince DiMartino
  • August 1 – Ross Whitaker Quintet
  • August 8 – Marlin McKay Quartet
  • August 15 – Osland/Dailiey Jazztet

The series begins at Moondance Amphitheater in May.
events.title: Big Band & Jazz

events.brief_description: The true story of Henry Hill, a half-Irish, half-Sicilian Brooklyn kid who is adopted by neighbourhood gangsters at an early age and climbs the ranks of a Mafia family under the guidance of Jimmy Conway.
events.description:
For almost two decades, The Kentucky Theatre has screened classic films every Wednesday (matinee and evening) from late May until early September. Over the years, this summer series has proved to be a perennial favorite. From film noir standards like The Maltese Falcon to classic Disney animation like Pinocchio and more recent classics like The Empire Strikes Back, the SUMMER CLASSICS offer something for every film fan. Come see movies from your youth, introduce your kids and grandkids to the stars of Hollywood's Golden Age, or discover a new personal favorite.

This week: The true story of Henry Hill, a half-Irish, half-Sicilian Brooklyn kid who is adopted by neighbourhood gangsters at an early age and climbs the ranks of a Mafia family under the guidance of Jimmy Conway. Hard-hitting and stylish, GoodFellas is a gangster classic — and arguably the high point of Martin Scorsese's career.
events.title: Summer Classics: GoodFellas

events.brief_description: Through their relentless hard work, non-stop touring and critically acclaimed /chart-breaking releases gaining over 250M streams/views across all platforms globally – JINJER are truly one of modern metal’s hottest and most exciting bands around today.
events.description: Through their relentless hard work, non-stop touring and critically acclaimed /chart-breaking releases gaining over 250M streams/views across all platforms globally – JINJER are truly one of modern metal’s hottest and most exciting bands around today. The band has become synonymous with doing things their own way and breaking every rule in the Heavy Metal handbook – which they made loudly clear on their hugely successful fourth studio album: WALLFLOWERS. In less than 12 years, the four-piece Progressive Groove metal wrecking machine known as JINJER have carved their very own place in the Metal landscape. Hailing from Donetsk but now based in Kiev, this Ukrainian musical oddity formed in 2009 but consider the official start of the band with the addition of the incredible vocalist and Femme Fatale Tatiana Shmayluk in 2010. The band labored intensively and honed their sound in practice rooms and local stages relentlessly, culminating in their now cult debut album release INHALE, DO NOT BREATHE in 2012 and winning Best Ukrainian Metal Band in 2013.
events.title: Jinjer

events.brief_description: Roy Wood Jr. is an Emmy-nominated comedian, writer, producer, actor, radio personality, and podcaster primarily known for his stand-up comedy and work as a correspondent on Comedy Central’s The Daily Show since 2015.
events.description:
Roy Wood Jr. is an Emmy-nominated comedian, writer, producer, actor, radio personality, and podcaster primarily known for his stand-up comedy and work as a correspondent on Comedy Central's The Daily Show since 2015.

He has executive produced several projects including the PBS documentary The Neutral Ground, an HBO MAX project 1% Happy and an untitled medical field comedy for NBC. He collaborates on two Comedy Central podcasts, Roy's Job Fair and Beyond the Scenes. In 2017, he was named the host of Comedy Central's This Is Not Happening. He has performed several stand-up specials on Comedy Central. His second stand-up special, Roy Wood Jr.: No One Loves You, remains Comedy Central's highest-rated original stand-up premiere.

TICKETS ARE NON-REFUNDABLE - ALL SALES ARE FINAL

Doors open 30 minutes prior to the show

All shows are 18 and up with ID

One Drink Minimum, Must be 21 with valid ID to purchase alcohol.
events.title: Roy Wood Jr.

events.brief_description: A live theatrical experience from the award-winning and critically-acclaimed audio drama podcast.
events.description:
Old Gods of Appalachia is an eldritch horror fiction podcast set in an Alternate Appalachia, a world where these mountains were never meant to be inhabited. This world feels eerily similar to the hills and hollers we've grown up with, but there are some tell-tale differences. Names of towns and counties may be altered. Historical events slide forward or backward in time. And then, of course, there are the monsters. Our live show includes a staged storytelling performance similar to an old time radio play, featuring show creators Steve Shell and Cam Collins, a rotating cast of professional actors, and live musical performances.

Old Gods of Appalachia is an award-winning and critically-acclaimed audio drama podcast produced by Asheville, NC based DeepNerd Media. Old Gods of Appalachia was the first professional podcast nominated for a World Fantasy Award in 2022, has received numerous Audioverse Awards (and is nominated for 32 more for 2022), and won Best Overall Podcast in the 2021 DiscoverPod Awards. The podcast boasts over 12 million unique downloads since its launch in late 2019. OGoA recently announced a roleplaying game based on the series to be produced by legendary game developer Monte Cook Games that met its funding goal of $50k within 10 minutes and raised over two million dollars on Kickstarter.
events.title: Old Gods of Appalachia Presents: The Price of Progress

events.brief_description: This renowned film essay reveals how humanity has grown apart from nature.
events.description:
We're launching a brand new film series at The Kentucky Theatre. Once a month at 10:00pm, Freaky Fridays will satisfy your craving for cult film. From Reefer Madness to Vampyros Lesbos to Gummo, Freaky Fridays will screen the weird, the surreal, the shocking, and the just plain so-bad-it's-good.

This month: Drawing its title from the Hopi word meaning "life out of balance," this renowned film essay reveals how humanity has grown apart from nature. Featuring extensive footage of natural landscapes and elemental forces, the film gives way to many scenes of modern civilization and technology. Given its lack of narration and dialogue, the production makes its points solely through stunning time-lapse imagery and music (by the famed composer, Philip Glass).
events.title: Freaky Fridays: Koyaanisqatsi

events.brief_description: Living history, memorialization, and commemoration of those enslaved at Ashland
events.description:
This event aims to highlight and showcase local and national voices, artists, experts, and descendants of the Ashland community through living history, memorialization, and commemoration of those enslaved at Ashland.

Throughout the day, there will be historic interpretations, choral performances, demonstrations, storytelling, and other activities.

Guests can find resources to trace their genealogy, obtain advice on using local archives, and explore the long, rich history of African American culinary, artisan, and craft traditions.
events.title: The Slave Dwelling Project & Vendor Fair

events.brief_description: It's about to get surreal
events.description:
Are you ready for games, challenges and an exploration of your unconscious mind? Prepare your team for our latest art-centric romp around Danville!

Assemble your four person team for our latest art-centric romp around Danville! This year's team competition features games and challenges inspired by Surrealist artists such as Salvador Dali, Frida Kahlo and Max Ernst. You will earn points toward a grand prize as you move from game to game throughout Danville! This is no ordinary race...Expand your mind – it's about to get surreal!

You will need:

  • comfortable shoes and clothing
  • a phone w/ camera
  • a spirit of adventure
  • a sense of humor!

A hotdog snack, non-alcoholic beverage, game materials, and art supplies will be provided by the Art Center.

Open to ages 14+
events.title: Don't Dilly Dali

events.brief_description: Explore - Listen - Eat - Shop
events.description:
Join Art Inc. Kentucky for the second annual East End Art and Music Festival on Saturday, August 19, 2023 from 3:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m at The Artists' Village on Goodloe St. in Lexington's historic East End neighborhood. Admission is free.

​

Grab some grub from food trucks, watch artist demonstrations, enjoy kids' activities like art exploration and the Kentucky Reptile Zoo, shop with vendors, and savor the sweet jazz and R&B sounds of the Keith McCutchen Trio featuring Mary Jackson.

​

For more information, call 859.231.0054 X1023 or follow Art Inc. Kentucky on Facebook
events.title: 2nd Annual East End Arts & Music Festival

events.brief_description: Photography Exhibition with Light Show and Musical Performance
events.description:
The Carnegie Center invites you to immerse yourself in an art exhibit of the senses, featuring live music by Trevor's Lightning Project and a retro-psychedelic light show by Liquified. Featured artists Ethan Portwood and Craig Stein will both host Artist Talks. Light refreshments will be served.


Resonance is a conversation between local artists Craig Stein and Ethan Portwood. While the disciplines of each artist differ, both bring emotion to the forefront of their work–whether it be through candid snapshots or the colors of a live performance reduced to their most primordial elements. By approaching the theme of emotional experience from radically different perspectives, Stein and Portwood show us that the collaboration between light and sound is fundamental to live photography, just as collaboration between people is fundamental to any artistic endeavor. Through the sometimes vibrant, sometimes muted scenes, the artists visualize the wavelength of our shared human experience.
events.title: Resonance Music and Light Exhibition

events.brief_description: High school seniors and best friends struggle to figure out if they can escape a dead-end town and build a better life somewhere else.
events.description:
For almost two decades, The Kentucky Theatre has screened classic films every Wednesday (matinee and evening) from late May until early September. Over the years, this summer series has proved to be a perennial favorite. From film noir standards like The Maltese Falcon to classic Disney animation like Pinocchio and more recent classics like The Empire Strikes Back, the SUMMER CLASSICS offer something for every film fan. Come see movies from your youth, introduce your kids and grandkids to the stars of Hollywood's Golden Age, or discover a new personal favorite.

This week: High school seniors and best friends, Sonny (Timothy Bottoms) and Duane (Jeff Bridges), live in a dying Texas town. The handsome Duane is dating local beauty, Jacy (Cybill Shepherd), while Sonny is having an affair with the coach's wife, Ruth (Cloris Leachman). As graduation nears, both boys contemplate their futures. While Duane eyes the army and Sonny takes over a local business, each boy struggles to figure out if he can escape this dead-end town and build a better life somewhere else.
events.title: Summer Classics: The Last Picture Show

events.brief_description: Live music on Southland Drive
events.description:
May

Time to make your Memorial Day Weekend plans! We are bringing the party to Southland Drive with live music by The Reverend Peyton's Big Damn Band plus Southland Jamboree Kickoff with Mama Said String Band, and The New Beckham County Ramblers

About:

Tahlsound is a family-friendly, donation-based/pay-what-you-can concert series that takes place at 302 Southland Drive, in the Oleika Temple Great Lawn, every 4th Sunday in the months of April, May, July, August & September. Patrons are invited to bring a blanket or chair and enjoy an evening of local and regional musicians and artists, as well as food and beverage vendors, and hands-on activities, crafts and games in the "Tahlsound Kid's Corner." More information, registration and reservations for "Friends of Tahlsound Tables" are available at www.tahlsound.com.
events.title: Tahlsound

events.brief_description: A comedic send-up of the grim circumstances of the Middle Ages as told through the story of King Arthur and framed by a modern-day murder investigation.
events.description:
For almost two decades, The Kentucky Theatre has screened classic films every Wednesday (matinee and evening) from late May until early September. Over the years, this summer series has proved to be a perennial favorite. From film noir standards like The Maltese Falcon to classic Disney animation like Pinocchio and more recent classics like The Empire Strikes Back, the SUMMER CLASSICS offer something for every film fan. Come see movies from your youth, introduce your kids and grandkids to the stars of Hollywood's Golden Age, or discover a new personal favorite.

This week: A comedic send-up of the grim circumstances of the Middle Ages as told through the story of King Arthur and framed by a modern-day murder investigation. When the mythical king of the Britons leads his knights on a quest for the Holy Grail, they face a wide array of horrors, including a persistent Black Knight, a three-headed giant, a cadre of shrubbery-challenged knights, the perilous Castle Anthrax, a killer rabbit, a house of virgins, and a handful of rude Frenchmen.
events.title: Summer Classics: Monty Python and the Holy Grail

events.brief_description: The Wastelanders is an artist’s collective founded in 2007
events.description:
It includes members from the region in and around Paducah in far Western Kentucky with a diversity of mediums and approaches to their craft.

The group is currently comprised of 10 members, 8 of whom are represented in this show.

 

For the past 16 years The Wasterlanders have mounted 2 large exhibits a year coinciding with the Winter and Summer Solstice and culminating with a well-attended reception on New Year's Eve, making us part of the fabric of Paducah's Unesco + designation as a Creative Arts Community.

 

 The Wastelanders goals are simple: to champion the local arts scene through exhibition, including featuring guest artists in their shows, to honor the legacy of past founding members who worked tirelessly to see the group succeed and to continue to contribute to the growth of the local arts and culture scene through community involvement. The exhibition features the work of  

Mark Donham, Jason Hargrove, Ben Walker, LaNelle Mason, Toney Little, Juanita Gilliam, Sandra Pfeifer, and Curtis Grace.
events.title: The Wastelanders

events.brief_description: Jeffrey "The Dude" Lebowski finds himself dragged into a strange series of events involving nihilists, adult film producers, ferrets, errant toes, and large sums of money.
events.description:
For almost two decades, The Kentucky Theatre has screened classic films every Wednesday (matinee and evening) from late May until early September. Over the years, this summer series has proved to be a perennial favorite. From film noir standards like The Maltese Falcon to classic Disney animation like Pinocchio and more recent classics like The Empire Strikes Back, the SUMMER CLASSICS offer something for every film fan. Come see movies from your youth, introduce your kids and grandkids to the stars of Hollywood's Golden Age, or discover a new personal favorite.

This week: Jeffrey "The Dude" Lebowski, a Los Angeles slacker who only wants to bowl and drink White Russians, is mistaken for another Jeffrey Lebowski, a wheelchair-bound millionaire, and finds himself dragged into a strange series of events involving nihilists, adult film producers, ferrets, errant toes, and large sums of money.
events.title: Summer Classics: The Big Lebowski

events.admission_fee: Adults: $25; Student & Youth (17 & Under): $11; Children (10 & Under): Free
events.brief_description: Immersive evening of music, art, & nature!
events.description:
Back for the third year, join LexPhil and Josephine Sculpture Park in Frankfort, KY for an evening of immersive music, art, and nature at Symphonic Stroll on Saturday, September 9th! 


  Paired with sculptures throughout the park, LexPhil Musicians perform chamber music continually from 4PM - 8PM. This inclusive event for all-ages features live music, interactive music activities, and local food trucks. Choose between two entry times, 4PM and 5PM, and then explore the beautiful grounds of the park at your own pace. Event ends at 8PM.


  General Admission tickets are $25 for adults, $11 for Youth and Students, and FREE for children 10 and under.


  For more information about parking, getting around, what to wear, and to buy your tickets* visit lexphil.org/symphonic-stroll


* In the event this event is postponed to the rain date, ticket holders will be contacted via email.
events.title: Symphonic Stroll

events.description:
We are excited to announce the return of our annual Wiener Dog Races! Join us Sunday, September 10 for an afternoon of good ole' family fun and live entertainment!


Bring the whole family out for FREE & enjoy Live Harness Racing, Wiener Dog Races & Doggie Dash, Doggie Costume Contest, Face Painting, Food, Snowie Ice, Live Music, and MORE!
events.title: 2023 Wiener Dog Races & Doggie Dash

events.brief_description: Live jazz at Central Library
events.description:
June: Vibraphonist Rusty Burge and the Phil DeGregg Trio

July: Retro Nouveau

August: Mike Wade Quintet

September: Meghan Pund Quartet


Jazz: Live at the Library! Jazz: Live at the Library, the series, which began April 12, 2007, takes place in the Lexington Central (downtown) Library Farish Theater on the second Thursday of each month from 7:00 – 8:15 p.m., and is free to the public. The Jazz Arts Foundation is proud to present a monthly series of live jazz performances by some of the region’s best musicians who will bring back to life the golden age of local jazz. Since its inception in March 2007, the series has brought in 237 different top-flight musicians & educators from Lexington, Cincinnati, Bloomington, Columbus, and Louisville areas. International musicians from Brazil and Russia have also performed as part of the Jazz: Live at the Library Concert Series. This concert series is made possible by a generous donation from Jamey Aebersold Jazz, which allows JAF to continue to bring in new musicians and fan favorites to fulfill its mission of “Enhancing the Awareness of Jazz as a Performing Art.”
events.title: Jazz at the Library

events.brief_description: On HOP night, dozens of galleries, museums, artists’ studios, and creative spaces conventional-and-un, collectively throw open their doors.
events.description:
That’s LexArts HOP night, eagerly anticipated, enthusiastically attended, a choose-your-own-adventure event designed to put you in the rooms with a stimulating cross-section of local visual art.

 

On HOP night, dozens of galleries, museums, artists’ studios, and creative spaces conventional-and-un, collectively throw open their doors. And everyone, from seasoned Hoppers to arts newbies to just-lookers, to collectors, to people simply wanting to make the scene, is welcome to wander in.

 

HOP has something for locals and visitors alike. A chance to encounter the visual arts up close and personal. To expand horizons, cultivate taste, open eyes and minds. To browse venue after venue of unique, affordable works in a dizzying spectrum of media, materials and genres. To socialize with friends and strangers. To put faces to the artists who envision and create these works. And to maybe start a new collection or add the perfect piece to an existing one.

 

HOP happens six times a year, because it’s more than even the most ambitious can take in on a single Friday night. And because Lexington’s vibrant visual arts scene never stands still — new exhibitions and new sites rotate in and out of an ever-changing roster — there’s always something new to experience.

 

Some HOP sites are pop-ups, but many have regular hours that you can find in the OFFICIAL HOP GUIDE.

 

Official HOP Guides will be available at LexArts on Mill, 161 N. Mill and at all participating sites.
events.title: LexArts Gallery HOP

events.brief_description: Hoping to find a sense of connection to her late mother, Gorgeous takes a trip to the countryside to visit her aunt at their ancestral house.
events.description:
We're launching a brand new film series at The Kentucky Theatre. Once a month at 10:00pm, Freaky Fridays will satisfy your craving for cult film. From Reefer Madness to Vampyros Lesbos to Gummo, Freaky Fridays will screen the weird, the surreal, the shocking, and the just plain so-bad-it's-good.

This month: Hoping to find a sense of connection to her late mother, Gorgeous takes a trip to the countryside to visit her aunt at their ancestral house. She invites her six friends, Prof, Melody, Mac, Fantasy, Kung Fu, and Sweet, to join her. The girls soon discover that there is more to the old house than meets the eye.
events.title: Freaky Fridays: House

events.admission_fee: $16 ($12 seniors 62+ and first responders/military, $8 children 6-12, children 5 and under free)
events.brief_description: Celebrate all things fall and kick off the harvest season with a down-home celebration for the entire family!
events.description:
Celebrate all things fall and kick off the harvest season with a down-home celebration for the entire family! Help us process sorghum and press apples for cider while learning the history of these crops at Pleasant Hill (we promise you'll get to taste the fruits of your labor as well). Take a hayride, paint a pumpkin, climb haystacks, ride a pony and play in the hay maze. Shop for honey, breads and jams at the Harvest Market. Watch craft demonstrations and play festival games. Meet the Farm animals and try farm-made concoctions.

Live music, an outdoor bar and a variety of food trucks help complete this perfect September weekend.

Harvest Fest is included in your general admission to Shaker Village, granting you access to this event, as well as historic tours, exhibits and more!
events.title: 2023 Harvest Fest

events.brief_description: Trae has written a best-selling book, toured the country thrice over playing sold out theatre shows, and more.
events.description:
​Due to unforeseen circumstances, outside of the control of the Artist, Trae Crowder's show has been rescheduled from Saturday, July 22nd to Friday, September 29th. All tickets purchased for the original show will be honored at the new date. Refunds are available by request until August 26th.

​​​Trae Crowder first gained international attention (or notoriety depending on your politics) in 2016 for his hugely viral series of "Liberal Redneck" comedic "porch rant" videos. Since then, Trae has written a best-selling book, The Liberal Redneck Manifesto: Draggin Dixie Outta The Dark, toured the country thrice over playing sold out theatre shows under the WellRED Comedy Tour banner, appeared on Real Time with Bill Maher (HBO), Nightline (ABC), The View, Last Word with Lawrence O'Donnell (MSNBC), NPR, WTF with Marc Maron, MTV, CNN, Huffington Post and in the Veronica Mars reboot, as "Chattanooga Charlie," among many others.

Initially from rural Celina, TN, Trae now lives in Los Angeles, CA and has developed and sold five scripted pilots for Warner Bros TV, ABC, and FOX and continues to work as a writer. Trae stars in and produces regular sketches for Comedy Central, Funny or Die, ATTN, Facebook Watch, New York Daily News which have garnered tens of millions of views online. Crowder also co-wrote and produced an hour-long documentary titled Inherent Good, featuring Crowder and former presidential candidate Andrew Yang, about universal basic income.

Additionally, Trae co-hosts the hugely popular Well RED, Evening Skews and Puttin' On Airs podcasts. His debut 30-minute standup comedy special was taped in 2021 in Nashville, TN. He also continues to rant and rave on the internet to the mostly-delight of his lovely fan base.
events.title: Trae Crowder

events.brief_description: Bring the kids for a fun and spooky evening along the Village road gathering treats (and maybe even a trick or two)!
events.description:
Bring the kids for a fun and spooky evening along the Village road gathering treats (and maybe even a trick or two)!

Take a hayride, enjoy live music, food trucks, pony rides and warming up by the bonfires. Make a kids' craft in-between candy stops and take part in our selfie station costume contest.
events.title: Shaker Village 2023 Trick-or-Treat

events.brief_description: Celebration of reading, writing and publishing.
events.description: A program of Kentucky Humanities, the Kentucky Book Festival is a celebration of reading, writing, and publishing which takes place each fall. Festival events seek to connect book-lovers and authors, spark engaging conversations, and empower readers by providing access to new books as well as opportunities to learn more about writing in a fun, supportive environment. It’s the biggest bookish celebration in Kentucky! Learn about writing and publishing, discover new books, make memories with family and friends, and celebrate reading!
events.title: Kentucky Book Festival

events.brief_description: Humans and Replicants (18+) are invited to walk along the pages of Philip K. Dick's 1968 cyberpunk dystopian novel "Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?"
events.description:
We are thrilled to announce this year's Carnegie Classics book choice, DO ANDROIDS DREAM OF ELECTRIC SHEEP? by Philip K. Dick, the classic book that inspired the 1982 film Blade Runner, directed by Ridley Scott.


Humans and Replicants (18+) are invited to walk along the pages of Philip K. Dick's 1968 cyberpunk dystopian novel "Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?" on Saturday, November 4, 7-11 PM at the Carnegie Center.

Explore sounds and visuals designed to awaken empathy and prove our humanity. Guests can escape the off-world colonies through special performances by Everyone Lives, Everyone Wins, Leaden Verse, and DJ David Austin.

Come dressed in your 80s / post-apocalyptic best for a literary experience you won't forget!


Tickets are now available for purchase on our website https://carnegiecenterlex.org/carnegie-classics-androids/ or call (859) 254–4175, ext 21.


Sponsored by Kentucky Arts Council, LexArts, and Reitzel Cook Foundation.
events.title: Carnegie Classics: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?

events.brief_description: If you love the film, you'll love this spirited stage adaptation with terrific choreography, a heartwarming story and the holiday tunes you love.
events.description:
The perfect way to ring in the holiday season is to "Let Yourself Go," "Count Your Blessings," and have a "Happy Holiday" with Irving Berlin's White Christmas. If you love the film, you'll love this spirited stage adaptation with terrific choreography, a heartwarming story and the holiday tunes you love. Bring the family and ring in the season with this classic musical.

The Lexington Theatre Company combines Broadway veterans, rising stars and local professionals for a production that feels just like Broadway, crafted right here in Lexington.
events.title: The Lex Presents: White Christmas
